trans-unit.source: This class contains the LINQ to XML extension methods that enable you to evaluate XPath expressions.
There is some performance penalty for using these methods.
Using [!INCLUDE[sqltecxlinq](~/includes/sqltecxlinq-md.md)] queries yields better performance.
Although the ordering of returned collections is not specified in the XML XPath Language 1.0 Recommendation, this extension method returns nodes in document order.
Note that nodes are returned in document order even when you use a reverse axis, such as `preceding-sibling` or `ancestor-or-self`.
Creates an <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator"></xref> for an <xref href="System.Xml.Linq.XNode"></xref>.
You cannot edit the XML tree by using the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator> that is returned by this method.
The <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator.CanEdit%2A> property returns `false`.
You cannot create an <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator> for a <xref:System.Xml.Linq.XDocumentType> node.
Document types do not participate in the XPath data model.
Namespace declarations are reported from left to right.
In contrast, for <xref:System.Xml.XmlDocument> namespaces are reported from right to left.
This is conformant behavior because namespace declarations are not ordered in the XPath data model.
The method <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator.MoveToId%2A> is not supported for navigators that are returned by this method.
You can use this method to perform an XSLT transformation.
You can create an XML tree, create an <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator> from the XML tree, create a new document, and create a <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter> that will write into the new document.
Then, you can invoke the XSLT transformation, passing the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator> and <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter> to the transform.
After the transformation successfully completes, the new XML tree is populated with the results of the transformation.
To perform an XSLT transformation, you can use either an <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> or an <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator>.
The two approaches have different performance characteristics.
Some transformations will execute faster when using an <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader>, and others will execute faster when using a <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator>.
If performance is a concern, we recommend that you experiment with each approach to determine which will perform better in your circumstances.
An <xref href="System.Xml.Linq.XNode"></xref> that can process XPath queries.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator"></xref> that can process XPath queries.
Creates an <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator"></xref> for an <xref href="System.Xml.Linq.XNode"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNameTable"></xref> enables more efficient XPath expression processing.
You cannot edit the XML tree using the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator> that is returned by this method.
The <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator.CanEdit%2A> property returns `false`.
You cannot create an <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator> for a <xref:System.Xml.Linq.XDocumentType> node.
Document types do not participate in the XPath data model.
Namespace declarations are reported from left to right.
In contrast, for <xref:System.Xml.XmlDocument> namespaces are reported from right to left.
This is conformant behavior because namespace declarations are not ordered in the XPath data model.
The method <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator.MoveToId%2A> is not supported for navigators that are returned by this method.
If you use an <xref:System.Xml.XmlNameTable> with this method to create the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator>, you will get better performance when evaluating XPath expressions.
An <xref href="System.Xml.Linq.XNode"></xref> that can process an XPath query.
A <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNameTable"></xref> to be used by <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator"></xref> that can process XPath queries.
Evaluates an XPath expression.
If the collection is an enumeration of elements or attributes, you can use the `Cast` operator to get a collection of <xref:System.Xml.Linq.XElement> or <xref:System.Xml.Linq.XAttribute>.
Although the ordering of returned collections is not specified in the XML XPath Language 1.0 Recommendation, this extension method returns nodes in document order.
Note that nodes are returned in document order even when you use a reverse axis, such as `preceding-sibling` or `ancestor-or-self`.
The <xref href="System.Xml.Linq.XNode"></xref> on which to evaluate the XPath expression.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains an XPath expression.
An object that can contain a `bool`, a `double`, a `string`, or an <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1"></xref>.
Evaluates an XPath expression, resolving namespace prefixes using the specified <xref href="System.Xml.IXmlNamespaceResolver"></xref>.
You can use this method to evaluate XPath expressions that contain namespace prefixes.
Although the ordering of returned collections is not specified in the XML XPath Language 1.0 Recommendation, this extension method returns nodes in document order.
Note that nodes are returned in document order even when you use a reverse axis, such as `preceding-sibling` or `ancestor-or-self`.
The <xref href="System.Xml.Linq.XNode"></xref> on which to evaluate the XPath expression.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains an XPath expression.
A <xref href="System.Xml.IXmlNamespaceResolver"></xref> for the namespace prefixes in the XPath expression.
An object that contains the result of evaluating the expression.
The object can be a `bool`, a `double`, a `string`, or an <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1"></xref>.
Selects an <xref href="System.Xml.Linq.XElement"></xref> using a XPath expression.
The <xref href="System.Xml.Linq.XNode"></xref> on which to evaluate the XPath expression.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains an XPath expression.
An <xref href="System.Xml.Linq.XElement"></xref>, or null.
Selects an <xref href="System.Xml.Linq.XElement"></xref> using a XPath expression, resolving namespace prefixes using the specified <xref href="System.Xml.IXmlNamespaceResolver"></xref>.
You can use this method to evaluate XPath expressions that contain namespace prefixes.
The <xref href="System.Xml.Linq.XNode"></xref> on which to evaluate the XPath expression.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains an XPath expression.
An <xref href="System.Xml.IXmlNamespaceResolver"></xref> for the namespace prefixes in the XPath expression.
An <xref href="System.Xml.Linq.XElement"></xref>, or null.
Selects a collection of elements using an XPath expression.
Although the ordering of returned collections is not specified in the XML XPath Language 1.0 Recommendation, this extension method returns nodes in document order.
Note that nodes are returned in document order even when you use a reverse axis, such as `preceding-sibling` or `ancestor-or-self`.
The <xref href="System.Xml.Linq.XNode"></xref> on which to evaluate the XPath expression.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains an XPath expression.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1"></xref> of <xref href="System.Xml.Linq.XElement"></xref> that contains the selected elements.
Selects a collection of elements using an XPath expression, resolving namespace prefixes using the specified <xref href="System.Xml.IXmlNamespaceResolver"></xref>.
You can use this method to evaluate XPath expressions that contain namespace prefixes.
Although the ordering of returned collections is not specified in the XML XPath Language 1.0 Recommendation, this extension method returns nodes in document order.
Note that nodes are returned in document order even when you use a reverse axis, such as `preceding-sibling` or `ancestor-or-self`.
The <xref href="System.Xml.Linq.XNode"></xref> on which to evaluate the XPath expression.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains an XPath expression.
A <xref href="System.Xml.IXmlNamespaceResolver"></xref> for the namespace prefixes in the XPath expression.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1"></xref> of <xref href="System.Xml.Linq.XElement"></xref> that contains the selected elements.
